did.unittitle: Winston Churchill letter to Jesse Merritt
did.abstract: One brief typewritten letter from Winston Churchill (1874-1965) to Jesse Merritt (1889-1957) concerning a previous letter Merritt had sent about Sir George Downing's connection to 10 Downing Street (the headquarters of the British Prime Minister) and an unnamed university. The letter is dated September 14, 1943 and signed by Churchill. Jesse Merritt (1889-1957) was a Quaker resident of Farmingdale in Nassau County, Long Island, N.Y. He was an historian of the Nassau County region and President of Bethpage Press in Farmingdale.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One brief typewritten letter from Winston Churchill to Jesse Merritt concerning a previous letter Merritt had sent about Sir George Downing's connection to 10 Downing Street (the headquarters of the British Prime Minister) and an unnamed university. The letter is dated September 14, 1943 and signed by Churchill.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Winston Churchill (1874-1965) was a British politician who led Great Britain as Prime Minister during World War II (1939-1945).
Jesse Merritt (1889-1957) was a Quaker resident of Farmingdale in Nassau County, Long Island, N.Y. He was an historian of the Nassau County region and President of Bethpage Press in Farmingdale.
